item.title: Android adding int value from one class to main class
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Sup22211:

What is that “dependency injection”

en.wikipedia.org

Dependency injection

In software engineering, dependency injection is a technique whereby one object (or static method) supplies the dependencies of another object. A dependency is an object that can be used (a service). An injection is the passing of a dependency to a dependent object (a client) that would use it. The service is made part of the client's state. Passing the service to the client, rather than allowing a client to build or find the service, is the fundamental requirement of the pattern. This fundamenta...

help yourself for once

Read full topic

item.title: Android adding int value from one class to main class
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Nvm your reply answered it for me. Use dependency injection to share MainActivity with all of your Levels. If you instantiate it in each class it will not be the same object as the one loaded by Android, therefore will not be able to do make any changes.

Read full topic
item.source: Android adding int value from one class to main class

item.title: Android adding int value from one class to main class
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

In android java i have saved an int, called “money” that integer saved (with SharedPreferences) in the mainActivity class (mainActivity class is the level select class for me), now in one of the levels (level 1) i have 3 answers and quesion, now when i answer the question correctly i want it to add 5 money, usually i would do that like this : money+=5; but for some reason when i get back to the mainActivity class (using intent) i dont see the money increased (the money shows in textView)
Edit:
what do you mean HcoJustin

Read full topic

item.title: Android adding int value from one class to main class
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Im trying to pass an int from “level1” class to “MainActivity” class, what i mean is;
in mainactivity class i have “money” int(the int is saved in the mainactivity class), in level1 class i have a question that when i answer the question correctly i want to add 5 to the money so i did that;
in level1 class MainActivity m = new MainActivity();
in level1 class in the question (when i answer correct) m.money+=5;
then when the intent open back the mainactivity class its dont adding 5 to the money int, any ideas?

Read full topic
